TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection extends System.Windows.Forms.BaseCollection implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Collections.IList

public ref class DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection : System::Windows::Forms::BaseCollection, System::Collections::IList
type DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection = class inherit BaseCollection interface IList interface ICollection interface IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects that are selected in a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The order of columns in the collection is not guaranteed to match the order in which they were selected.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewSelectedColumnCollection> does not perform efficiently when working with large numbers of columns. Typically, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> controls will not contain enough columns for this to be an issue, but if you are working with large numbers of columns, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.AreAllCellsSelected%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> to determine if the entire grid is selected, or you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnCollection.GetColumnCount%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> to determine the number of selected columns (or the number of columns in a specified state). For more information, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).

Docs.related: Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control
